primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God, in His mercy, initiates a new birth in the believer, granting a new vitality and identity that shifts the believer's hope from perishable worldly objects to an imperishable heavenly inheritance through the work of Christ.

tekstueel_bewijs: In his great mercy he has given us new birth
God puts his Spirit in us
God shakes you... he wants to get you to build your nest in the rock

object.identificatie: New Birth / Living Hope / Imperishable Inheritance
tekstueel_bewijs: new birth into a living hope
an inheritance that can never perish
Praise be to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ!
he has given us new birth
through the resurrection of Jesus Christ
Jesus Christ perished in your place
by the Holy Spirit sent from heaven
helper.rol_van_god: God is both Subject (Initiator) and Helper (Mediator in Christ).
helper.rol_van_geest: External power that becomes indwelling vitality ('implantation of a new kind of life').

tekstueel_bewijs: every tree in this world is coming down
suffer grief in all kinds of trials
we fail each other, we fail God
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is the inherent decay of the fallen world ('perishability') and the human tendency to build lives on 'trees' that will be cut down.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer's growth and response to suffering by 'pulling the heart off' worldly hopes to rest in the Gospel.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (sanctification) is a result of the primary program (regeneration). The believer acts only because God has first implanted the 'palingenesia'.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God the Father → New Birth/Hope → The Church

voorbeelden_god_subject: He has given us new birth
God puts his lifeblood in us

voorbeelden: Every person who is a Christian has to experience the new birth
angels long to look into these things
we need to immediately say there are an enormous number of varieties
The potential to change things... You have it!

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Power' (Pouvoir) granted by God. It is not about what the hearer must do (Devoir), but what the hearer is now able to do because of the indwelling resurrection power.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from the 'Perishable Hopes' (~S1) to the reality of 'Perishing' (S2), then reveals that Christ took the 'Perishing' (S2) to grant 'Imperishable Hope' (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Substitutionary: Jesus perishes so the hope does not.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. The 'lumberjack' and 'perishing' metaphors emphasize the total loss of all non-God foundations.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It defines Christianity not as a human effort or a 'type' of experience, but as a divine implantation of life. The 'Subject' of salvation is consistently God.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the active Subject of regeneration
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: In his great mercy he has given us new birth
Your hope is imperishable because Jesus Christ perished.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (Augustine, Prophets) are used to illustrate the power of God's work, not as moral templates for the hearer to copy by their own strength.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and empowerment; shifting focus from self-performance to Christ's performance.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic regeneration leading to synergistic sanctification.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon perfectly integrates the 'What, Where, How, and Why' into a single narrative of God's grace.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ perished in your place... it’s not based on our performance anymore; it’s based on his performance.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir-faire' (Power to change) that the human Subject lacks.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; requires the death of the Messiah to overcome.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is God-driven. The hearer is positioned as the beneficiary of a cosmic act.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it effectively counters moralism.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in grace-oriented homiletics, maintaining God as the Subject of the active verbs throughout.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'What/Where/How/Why' structure, semiotics reveals that the 'Why' (Christ's substitution) is the actual actantial Helper that makes the Subject's (God) action possible.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek 'palingenesia'; semiotics shows how that word functions as a 'Modal Competence' (Pouvoir) for the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas' model exposes that even when the preacher tells the audience to 'pull their hearts off' (an action), it is framed as a response to the 'Sender's' (God) prior gift of an 'Object' (Inheritance).

appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the 'If-Then' trap of moralism by grounding the 'How' of growth in the 'Why' of Christ's finished work.
